content.description: Sit start with a left hand edge and a right hand crimp near the arete. From there, slap up to a great edge and match on it, gain the sloping incut shelf above, then follow the arete to the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Redcap.

content.description: Sit start with sidepulls and poor feet at the southeast arete. From there, climb through sidepulls and edges to reach good pockets and an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is uneven due to a rock but pads well.
content.location: It climbs the southeast arete of Redcap.

content.description: Sit start with a pair of edges and poor feet. From there, gain a good left hand edge, cross over it to a right hand sidepull, paste a high foot, bump the left hand up to an edge, follow with a big move to a jug before the lip, then mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing has a boulder behind it but is otherwise very good.
content.location: It climbs the south section of Redcap's east face.

content.description: Stand start with hands matched high on the lip. From there, work up and right along the lip to the jug apex, mantel onto the shelf, and finish up the remaining slab for an easy mantel.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing has several rocks in it.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Redcap.
